briefdescription.para: Translates an error code into an English error message.

parameterdescription.para: The qdb_error_t code outputted by another function

simplesect.para: A static, null terminated string describing the error. The buffer is API managed and should not be freed or written to by the caller.

briefdescription.para: Returns a null terminated string describing the API version.

simplesect.para: A static, null terminated string describing the API version. The buffer is API managed and should not be freed or written to by the caller.

briefdescription.para: Returns a null terminated string describing the exact API build.

simplesect.para: A static, null terminated string describing the exact API build. The buffer is API managed and should not be freed or written to by the caller.

briefdescription.para: Creates a qdb_handle_t. No connection will be established.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a qdb_handle_t that will be ready to connect to a cluster.
The protocol to use.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_connect, qdb_open_tcp, qdb_protocol_t

briefdescription.para: Creates a TCP/IP qdb_handle_t. No connection will be established.

simplesect.para: An initialized qdb_handle_t, ready to connect, in case of success, NULL in case of failure.
qdb_connect, qdb_open

briefdescription.para: Sets the timeout of all network operations.

parameterdescription.para: The qdb_handle_t that was initialized with qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp
The timeout of network operation, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
The lower the timeout, the higher the risk of having timeout errors.

briefdescription.para: Adds a callback that will receive internal API log messages. This can be used to incorporate internal API statuses in your log.

parameterdescription.para: A callback of type qdb_log_callback. The callback will be called every time the API logs
A pointer to an unique callback identifier that can be used to remove the callback

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_log_callback, qdb_option_remove_log_callback

briefdescription.para: Removes a previously added log callback.

parameterdescription.para: The identifier set by qdb_option_add_log_callback that will determine which callback to remove

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_log_callback, qdb_option_add_log_callback

briefdescription.para: Set the compression level for all future messages emitted by the specified handle. Regardless of this parameter, the API will be able to read whatever compression the server uses.

parameterdescription.para: The handle on which to set the compression level
The compression level to use

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
For better performance, consider disabling compression if your data is already compressed.

briefdescription.para: Binds the client instance to a quasardb cluster and connect to at least one node within.

detaileddescription.para: Quasardb URI are in the form qdb://[address]:[port] where address is either an IPv4 or IPv6 or a domain name. It is recommended to specify multiple addresses should the designated node be unavailable.

URI Examples:
qdb://myserver.org:2836 - Connects to myserver.org on the port 2836
qdb://127.0.0.1:2836 - Connects to the local IPv4 loopback on the port 2836
qdb://myserver1.org:2836,myserver2.org:2836 - Connects to myserver1.org or myserver2.org on the port 2836
qdb://::1:2836 - Connects to the local IPv6 loopback on the port 2836

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the URI of the quasardb cluster to connect to.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_open, qdb_open_tcp
Make sure all the addresses in the URI belong to the same cluster

briefdescription.para: Closes the handle previously opened with qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.

detaileddescription.para: This results in terminating all connections and releasing all internal buffers, including buffers which may have been allocated as or a result of batch operations or get operations.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
API-allocated buffers may be released by this call. For example, the buffer allocated by qdb_blob_get may be released by this call.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const void *source_buffer, qdb_size_t source_buffer_size, const void **dest_buffer)
memberdef.name: qdb_copy_alloc_buffer

briefdescription.para: Creates a clone of a buffer using API's high-performance memory allocator.

detaileddescription.para: The allocated buffer has to be released later with qdb_free_buffer.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a buffer to clone
The size of the buffer to clone
A pointer to a a pointer of an API-allocated buffer whose content will be a copy of the source buffer

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Releases an API allocated buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Failure to properly call this function may result in excessive memory usage. Most operations that return a content (e.g. batch operations, qdb_blob_get, qdb_blob_get_and_update, qdb_blob_compare_and_swap...) will allocate a buffer for the content and will not release the allocated buffer until you either call this function or close the handle.
For API functions that returns a collection of results, use qdb_free_results.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to an API allocated buffer to release. The behavior for non API buffers is undefined.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Results a collection of API allocated results.

detaileddescription.para: Functions that returns a list of results expect the API-allocated buffers to be released with qdb_free_results.

Example of such functions:
qdb_prefix_get
qdb_get_tagged
qdb_get_tags
For API functions that return a single content, use qdb_free_buffer.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A collection of results returned by a quasardb API call.
The number of results returned by the quasardb API call.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Removes an entry from the cluster, regardless of its type.

detaileddescription.para: This call will remove the entry, whether it is a blob, integer, deque, stream or hset. It will properly untag the entry. If the entry spawns on multiple entries or nodes (deques, hsets and streams) all blocks will be properly removed.
The call is ACID, regardless of the type of the entry and a transaction will be created if need be.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Sets the absolute expiration time of an entry, if the type supports expiration.

detaileddescription.para: Blobs and integers can have an expiration time and will automatically be removed by the cluster when they expire.

The absolute expiration time is the Unix epoch, that is, the number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00h00 (UTC). To use a relative expiration time (that is expiration relative to the time of the call), use qdb_expires_from_now.
To remove the expiration time of an entry, use the specify value qdb_never_expires.
Values in the past are refused, but the cluster will have a certain tolerance to account for clock skews.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
The new, absolute UTC expiration time.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
It is an error to specify an expiration in the time, although the cluster has a certain tolerance

briefdescription.para: Sets the expiration time of an entry, relative to the current time of the client, if the type supports expiration.

detaileddescription.para: Blobs and integers can have an expiration time and will automatically be removed by the cluster when they expire.
The expiration is relative to the current time of the machine.
To remove the expiration time of an entry or to use an absolute expiration time use qdb_expires_at.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
The number of seconds, relative to the current time, after which the entry should expire.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the absolute expiration time of the given entry.

detaileddescription.para: The returned expiration time is the Unix epoch, UTC.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to an expiry time which will be set to the expiration of the entry if the call is successful.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the primary node of an entry.

detaileddescription.para: The exact location of an entry should be assumed random and users should not bother about its location as the API will transparently locate the best node for the requested operation.
This function is intended for higher level APIs that need to optimize transfers and potentially push computation close to the data.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a qdb_remote_node_t structure that will receive the address of the primary node of the entry if successful

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Gets the type of an entry, if it exists.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a qdb_entry_type_t that will receive the type of the entry if successful.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Removes irremediably all data from all the nodes of the cluster.

detaileddescription.para: This function is useful when quasardb is used as a cache and is not the golden source.
This call is not atomic: if the command cannot be dispatched on the whole cluster, it will be dispatched on as many nodes as possible and the function will return with a qdb_e_ok code.
By default cluster do not allow this operation and the function will return a qdb_e_operation_disabled error.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A timeout value, in seconds

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
Use this function at your own risk. This function causes irremediable data loss.

briefdescription.para: Trims all data on all the nodes of the cluster.

detaileddescription.para: quasardb uses Multi-Version Concurrency Control (MVCC) as a foundation of its transaction engine. It will automatically clean up old versions as entries are acceded.
This call is not atomic: if the command cannot be dispatched on the whole cluster, it will be dispatched on as many nodes as possible and the function will return with a qdb_e_ok code.
Entries that are not acceded may not be cleaned up, resulting in increasing disk usage.

This function will request each nodes to trim all entries, release unused memory and compact files on disk. Because this operation is I/O and CPU intensive, it is not recommended to run it when the cluster is heavily used.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A timeout value, in seconds

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function impacts the performance of the cluster.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *uri, const char **content, qdb_size_t *content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_node_status

briefdescription.para: Returns the status of a node.

detaileddescription.para: The API will request the node for its status and allocate a buffer of the appropriate size, which will later have to be releases with qdb_free_buffer.
The status is JSON object and contains current information of the node state, as described in the documentation.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the URI of node for which the status is requested
A pointer to the pointer of an API-allocated buffer holding the node status.
A pointer to an integer representing the size of the API-allocated buffer.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *uri, const char **content, qdb_size_t *content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_node_config

briefdescription.para: Returns the configuration of a node.

detaileddescription.para: The API will request the node for its configuration and allocate a buffer of the appropriate size, which will later have to be releases with qdb_free_buffer.
The configuration is JSON object, as described in the documentation.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the URI of the node for which the configuration is requested
A pointer to the pointer of an API-allocated buffer holding the node configuration.
A pointer to an integer representing the size of the API-allocated buffer.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *uri, const char **content, qdb_size_t *content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_node_topology

briefdescription.para: Returns the topology of a node.

detaileddescription.para: The API will request the node for its topology and allocate a buffer of the appropriate size, which will later have to be releases with qdb_free_buffer.
The topology is JSON object containing the node address, and the addresses of its successor and predecessor.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the URI of node for which the topology is requested
A pointer to the pointer of an API-allocated buffer holding the node topology.
A pointer to an integer representing the size of the API-allocated buffer.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Requests the node to gracefully stop.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to remotely stop a node, the supplied reason will be displayed in the logs of the remote node.
By default cluster do not allow this operation and the function will return a qdb_e_operation_disabled error.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the URI of node to be stopped
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string of the reason for the stop

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Creates an iterator that points to the "first" entry of the cluster.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables you to iterate on all the entries of a cluster. Keep in mind that there is no guarantee regarding the order of entries.
The iteration occurs at a fixed point in time, operations occurring after the iterator has been created will not be visible.
Call qdb_iterator_next to go to the next available entry, if any.
When iteration completes the function will return qdb_e_alias_not_found and the user must call qdb_iterator_close to release client allocated resources for the iteration.
Iteration does not allocate any resource on the server.
Whole cluster iteration is intended for some very specific use case. It is greatly advised to use tags to work on subgroup of entries.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to an uninitialized iterator structure that will be set to the first entry if successful

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_iterator_next, qdb_iterator_previous, qdb_iterator_close

briefdescription.para: Creates an iterator that points to the "last" entry of the cluster.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables you to iterate on all the entries of a cluster. Keep in mind that there is no guarantee regarding the order of entries.
This works exactly like qdb_iterator_begin, excepts it starts at the "end" of the cluster.
Call qdb_iterator_previous to go to the previous available entry, if any.
See qdb_iterator_begin for more information.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to an uninitialized iterator structure that will be set to the last entry if successful

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
qdb_iterator_begin, qdb_iterator_next, qdb_iterator_previous, qdb_iterator_close

briefdescription.para: Advances an iterator to the next entry, if any.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the iterator to point to the next available entry in the cluster. Although each entry is returned only once, the order in which entries are returned is undefined.If there is no following entry or it is otherwise unavailable, the function will return qdb_e_alias_not_found.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a previously initialized iterator.

briefdescription.para: Advances an iterator to the previous entry, if any.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the iterator to point to the previous available entry in the cluster. Although each entry is returned only once, the order in which entries are returned is undefined. If there is no previous entry or it is otherwise unavailable, the function will return qdb_e_alias_not_found.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a previously initialized iterator.

briefdescription.para: Closes a previously initialized iterator and releases all associated resources.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a previously initialized iterator.

simplesect.para: qdb_iterator_rbegin, qdb_iterator_begin

briefdescription.para: Clones a previously initialized iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the state of the original iterator to a new iterator. Both iterators can afterward be independently operated. The cloned iterator will have to be closed with qdb_iterator_close.

simplesect.para: qdb_iterator_rbegin, qdb_iterator_begin, qdb_iterator_close

briefdescription.para: Clones a previously initialized tag iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the state of the original iterator to a new iterator. Both iterators can afterward be independently operated. The cloned iterator will have to be closed with qdb_tag_iterator_close.

simplesect.para: qdb_tag_iterator_begin, qdb_tag_iterator_close

briefdescription.para: An arbitrary time value representing the "no expiration" time value.
An arbitrary time value representing the "preserve existing expiration" time value.
The maximum allowed length for aliases.
The minimum allowed length for prefix-based search.
An enumeration of API limits.
No compression.

detaileddescription.para: Maximum compression speed, potentially minimum compression ratio. This is currently the default.
Maximum compression ratio, potentially minimum compression speed. This is currently not implemented.

briefdescription.para: An enumeration of compression parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Uses TCP/IP to communicate with the cluster. This is currently the only supported network protocol.

briefdescription.para: An enumeration of allowed network protocols.
Log everything. Very verbose.
Log debug level messages and below.
Log information level messages and below.
Log warning level messages and below.
Log error level messages and below.
Log panic level messages and below. Very terse.
An enumeration of log level.
Uninitialized value.
A binary large object (blob)
A signed 64-bit integer.
A distributed hash set.
A tag.
A distributed double-entry queue (deque)
A distributed binary stream.
A enumeration representing possible entries type.
A cross-platform type that represents a time value.

simplesect.para: qdb_time_t MUST be 64-bit large. The API will probably not link otherwise.

briefdescription.para: An alias for size_t.
A cross-platform type that represents a signed 64-bit integer.
A type alias for enum qdb_limits.
A type alias for enum qdb_compression.
A type alias for enum qdb_protocol.
A type alias for enum qdb_log_level.
An opaque handle to internal API-allocated structures needed for maintaining connection to a cluster.
An unique callback identifier returned by qdb_option_add_log_callback.

memberdef.argsstring: )(qdb_log_level_t, const unsigned long *, unsigned long, unsigned long, const char *, size_t)
memberdef.name: qdb_log_callback

briefdescription.para: A typedef representing a log callback.

detaileddescription.para: The profile of the functions

briefdescription.para: A type alias for enum qdb_entry_type.
